item.title: Why knowing the interview structure matters?
item.description: An interview is a bidirectional process, ideally. However, most of the time, companies spend as much time as they consider necessary questioning candidates while giving a few-minutes-long opportunity for a candidate to find out more about the company or the culture or a team the candidate might be working with. I believe this is unfair. This approach may also introduce problems in the future after the candidate has become an employee.
